fields.description:
My main concern with Clover is that it shows coverage, not
*quality* coverage.  Depending on how the unit tests are written,
clover's results can give the development team and/or management a false
impression of how good the unit tests are.  Are there any plans to
include some sort of "quality metric" in future releases?
fields.summary: Quality Coverage

fields.description:
Clover 2 is generating an OOM while writing reports for a large build.  The build output is:

---
26-Oct-2007 03:13:12  clover-guard: 
26-Oct-2007 03:13:12      [javac] WARNING: The <testresults> element is deprecated. It will be ignored. 
26-Oct-2007 03:13:12      [javac] WARNING: The <testresults> element is deprecated. It will be ignored. 
26-Oct-2007 03:13:12      [javac] WARNING: The <testresults> element is deprecated. It will be ignored. 
26-Oct-2007 03:13:12  [clover-report] Clover Version 2.0.1, built on October 19 2007 
26-Oct-2007 03:13:12  [clover-report] Loaded from: /n/​bin/​ant/​apache-ant-1.6.5/​lib/​clover.jar 
26-Oct-2007 03:13:12  [clover-report] Clover: Open Source License registered to Limewire. 
26-Oct-2007 03:13:12  [clover-report] Loading coverage database from: '/n/​bin/​bamboo/​data/​xml-data/​build-dir/​LW-NIGHTLY/​limewire/​clover/​clover.db' 
26-Oct-2007 03:14:55  [clover-report] Writing report to '/n/​bin/​bamboo/​data/​xml-data/​build-dir/​LW-NIGHTLY/​limewire/​clover/​html' 
26-Oct-2007 03:17:06   
26-Oct-2007 03:17:06  BUILD FAILED 
26-Oct-2007 03:17:06  java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space 
---

(You can ignore the ​ character -- that's just Bamboo adding a character that doesn't display on IE6.)

I've attached the clover.db used for that build.  You can reproduce the problem by checking out limewire with:
 cvs -d:pserver:guest@cvs.limewire.org:/cvs login
 type guest for the password
 cvs -d:pserver:guest@cvs.limewire.org:/cvs checkout limewire

Then create a clover subdirectory within 'limewire', copy the clover.db into there.  From the limewire directory, type: ant with.clover clover2html
fields.summary: OOM Writing Reports
Document  new clover-setup attribute: fullyQualifyJavaLang

So, consider doing the following (particularly if 2.1 has no updates to the Upgrade Guide):
- delete 'Clover 2.0 Upgrade Guide' and move its contents into the main 'Clover Upgrade Guide' document
- because a new space will be created for every major release, simply update the main 'Clover Upgrade Guide' document whenever a major release occurs

fields.description:
The way tests are detected in Clover2 has been vastly extended.

The {{<testsources/>}} fileset now supports the following nested elements to make test case detection more finer grained.
{{<testclass name="regex" super="regex" annotation="regex">}}

And {{testclass}} has a {{testmethod}} element:
{{<testmethod name="regex" annotation="regex"/>}}

Here is a contrived example with every attributed and nested element set.

{code:xml}
<testSources dir="src">
                <include name="**/*Test.java"/>
                <testclass name=".*Test" super="TestCase" annotation="Test">
                    <testmethod name=".*Bag.*" annotation="Test"/>
                </testclass>
</testSources>
{code}
fields.summary: Document new test spec elements

fields.description:
We need to add the following scripts to the Clover tutorial:

clover.sh and clover.bat .

Both of these will:
# run [cloverinstr| http://cenqua.com/clover/doc/cli/cloverinstr.html] over the sources
# call javac on the instrumented sources
# run the unittests
# generate a [HTML|http://cenqua.com/clover/doc/cli/htmlreporter.html] by default
# generate an [XML|http://cenqua.com/clover/doc/cli/xmlreporter.html] report if called with the 'xml' parameter
# generate a [PDF|http://cenqua.com/clover/doc/cli/pdfreporter.html] report if called with the 'pdf' parameter
fields.summary: create simple shell and bat scripts to run the Command Line Tools with Clover2 on the tutorial.

fields.description:
To simplify configuration, Clover will now record all testresults in its database. There is no longer a need for a user to supply
the testresults nested element during report time.

_this feature may be re-added in the future if nescessary_

User's who still use the <testresults/> element will see a deprecation warning in the logs.
fields.summary: testresults element/attribute deprecated

fields.description:
The initial release of Clover2 will unfortunately not support per-test coverage for merged databases. 
This includes Maven multi-module projects.
Coverage data will be merged, there will however be no merging of test results.
fields.summary: document limitations for clover-merge, maven multi-module projects.

fields.description: http://cenqua.com/clover/doc/cli/overview.html
fields.summary: Add Clover 1 command line tools to Clover 2 docs

fields.description:
We have created an organisational pom file which includes a profile called bamboo which contains the entries required to use clover. When we run a build in bamboo we set the maven goal to test site -Pbamboo, so that the profile is activated. The idea behind this is so that bamboo can generate clover reports for all projects and developers can still build projects on their workstations, without the need for clover licenses on every workstation, only a single license on the development server on which bamboo runs would be required.

However, since upgrading to version 3.0 beta 5 of the maven clover plug in, builds fail when the above approach is taken, but build successfully when the clover entries are put directly into the project pom file.
fields.summary: Builds Fail with errors relating to JVM memory settings when entries for clover are put in a projects parent pom file.

fields.description:
see: http://www.cenqua.com/forums/thread.jspa?threadID=3260&tstart=0

{quote}Clover not only ignores no-arg getXXX methods and single-arg setXXX methods, but any getXXX method, isXXX method and setXXX method. 
{quote}

Change this to only match:
* setters with one arg
* getters with no args
fields.summary: improve default propert Context filter

fields.description:
I've noticed that some output from clover is being sent to stderr instead of stdout.  This is annoying because Bamboo highlights it as an error, and also, in principle because much of the text isn't reporting an error.

I've attached two screenshots of Bamboo where the errors are reported.  I've also included the stderr.txt and stdout.txt, output from a limited run on a local machine (not Bamboo).

If no errors are occurring than stderr should not be used for communicating with the end user.
fields.summary: Clover seems to dump a lot of output to stderr instead of std out

fields.description:
Given the following directory structure:

* root/master
* root/submodule1
* root/submodule2
* root/...

When trying to create an aggregated Clover report from the master directory of a mult-module project, I'm witnessing two related problems:

1) In the generate report (master/target/site/clover/index.html), there are no test results and the error message "No test results could be found. Please ensure that you have configured the location of your test results correctly using the <testresults> nested element." is displayed.

2) The following error occurs many times during the clover:aggregate goal: WARN: test class not found: com.ducks.deal.ClientSiteServiceImplTest. Obviously, it's repeated for each test class.

I'm using the command line: mvn clean clover:instrument clover:aggregate clover:clover

Note that when I use the command line "mvn clean clover:instrument clover:clover" (no aggregate) I get valid, error free reports in each submodule.

How are we supposed to produce a complete aggregated clover report from master which includes test results?

It seems like the clover:aggregate goal should gather all of the surefire test results in to target/clover/surefire-reports, or work around the fact that the results are located in the submodule target/clover/surefire-reports directories.

I've attached the output from "mvn clean clover:instrument clover:aggregate clover:clover".

Reference: http://www.cenqua.com/forums/thread.jspa?threadID=3257
fields.summary: Maven multi-module aggregate reports fail to include test results

fields.description:
It is possible that this has been fixed with Clover 2, in which case feel free to close this.

We are making a big push internally to track our Clover coverage, and we are finding the 'movers' report to be really helpful in that regard. We are sending out a nightly email showing the movers so that we can immediately see if developers are checking in code that is causing reductions in code coverage.

However, there is one oddity that is causing us trouble. When a new class is added to the code base, it appears that the report treats its 'old coverage' as being 0%. This means that a new class can be added without any tests at all, but it won't show up in the movers list. This is really bad for us, because we don't want to allow any code to be below our coverage threshold (we're aiming for 80% at the moment). Similarly, if a new class comes in with coverage at 50%, it is shown as an increase of 50%, even though this is still well below our current threshold. We really want classes coming in with no coverage to be considered a very bad thing in the movers report.

One simple option would be to assume that new classes come in with 100% coverage, so that if the coverage is not complete it will show up in the list of downward movers. A compromise would instead to take the previous average coverage (say 80%), and to require that the new class at least meets that level. So coming in at 100% would be seen as +20%, while coming in at 0% would show up as -80%.

Does this make sense? Has this already been implemented for Clover 2 reports?
fields.summary: Improving handling of new classes in the 'movers' report

fields.description:
Need to transform a stacktrace from

 junit.framework.AssertionFailedError 
 at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47)
 at junit.framework.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:20)

 at com.cenqua.samples.money.MoneyTest.*__CLR2_[a-z0-9]+*(MoneyTest.java:*87*)
 at com.cenqua.samples.money.MoneyTest.*testMoneyBagHash*(MoneyTest.java:*84*)
 at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

to 

 junit.framework.AssertionFailedError 
 at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47)
 at junit.framework.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:20)
 at junit.framework.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:27)
 at com.cenqua.samples.money.MoneyTest.*testMoneyBagHash*(MoneyTest.java:*87*)
 at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
fields.summary: write a stacktrace transformer

fields.description:
if Clover 1 is in the system or Ant classpath along with Clover 2, users will get non-obvious error:

java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.cenqua.clover.util.FileUtils.b(Ljava/lang/String;)Ljava/lang/String;
        at com.cenqua.clover.util.b.a(2.0b2-build-682:105)
        at com.cenqua.clover.tasks.CloverEnvTask.<clinit>(2.0b2-build-682:28)
        at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:242)
        at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Definer.addDefinition(Definer.java:457)

This happens because the static init code in CloverEnvTask assumes that Clover's ClassPathUtil class will be found. to fix, put an outer try/catch in.
fields.summary: Detect and report classpath problems early

fields.description:
We could add a new trouble shooting point here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOVER/Troubleshooting for unique test coverage.

Q. Why does the test result summary page report I have unique coverage, however the source page shows no unique coverage?

A. The source view only shows unique coverage aggregated at the line level, not per statement or branch. The unique coverage will be either that the test was the only one to follow a particular path through a branch; or that the test uniquely covered a statement on a line containing more than one statement.
fields.summary: A new Troubleshooting Q/A.

fields.description:
On the nested <current/> element in a <clover-report> task.
Or, as attributes on <clover-html-report/>

numThreads - sets the number of threads to start when generating a HTML report. A value of 0 will disable multi-threading for report generation. Default is 2.

timeout - the amount of time to wait for report generation to finish before failing the build. This value must be an [Interval | Specifying+an+Interval]

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
when migrating projects using the cloud to migrate between Jira sites, the custom issue types' icons are not being migrated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # have a custom issue type icon
 # migrate the project using the cloud to cloud migration tool

h3. Expected Results
issue types icons should be migrated

h3. Actual Results
Icons are not being migrated.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cloud to Cloud tool is not migrating issue types' icons

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * When migrating using C2C Jira Migration Assistant, video thumbnail size from source does not match with video thumbnail size at destination.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in source (ABC-1). Attach a video to comment.
 # Migrate ABC-1 from abc.atlassian.net to def.atlassian.net via C2C Jira Migration.

h3. Expected Results

Attachment thumbnail size is the same.
h3. Actual Results

Attachment thumbnail size is different.
In source:
!image-2021-12-15-11-58-35-632.png|thumbnail!

But in destination, it is larger:
!image-2021-12-15-11-59-18-094.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inconsistent Video Thumbnail using C2C Jira Migration Assistant

fields.description:
At this time, Cloud to cloud migration assistant doesn't migrate Advanced Roadmaps. This becomes a blocker in some migrations.

It would be great to have Advanced Roadmap migration included within C2C migration asstant.
fields.summary: Support Advanced Roadmap migration with cloud to cloud migration assistant

fields.description:
h3. Issue Statement

Currently if there are any failures during a Cloud to Cloud migration, the admin needs to reach out to support to look at the logs. This prevent self-serving and it delays troubleshooting the migrations. 

h3. Proposed Solution

Add logs to the post-migration reports to be downloaded by admins as is allowed for the Server version of JCMA: [Use the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant to migrate|https://support.atlassian.com/migration/docs/use-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-to-migrate/]

This will help our customers migrate from Cloud to another Cloud instance more quickly.
fields.summary: Allow admins to download Cloud to Cloud error logs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Many cloud sites do not have an adequate number of billing/technical contacts for the site in question.  This becomes a problem at the time of renewals when people leave a company and they are the only individual listed as a billing contact.  In turn this causes our renewal reminders to go unseen and unanswered.  Ultimately this tends to cause the site to reach an expired licensed, which locks out all the other users from being able to use the site at all.

h3. Suggested Solution
# I suggest that we have recommended number of billing/technical contacts on a per userbase status.  That is to say for sites with 1-10 users, at least 1 or 2 billing/tech contacts, sites with 11-100 users should have at least 3-4 such contacts, and so on.
# When a billing contact has not logged onto a Cloud site for an extended period of time (say 6 months on annual sites, or 25 days for monthly renewals), it might be more helpful to display a banner on the site for other site-admins/technical contacts to let them know about the user inactivity mixed with an upcoming renewal.
# It might also be helpful to try to send out email contacts to other users if possible ahead of the time of renewal

h3. Why this is important
When a site expires the license and is not renewed, it frequently requires users create a customer advocate ticket CA, in order to resolve this, even after things like payment details are updated.  Those tickets add to the time in which end users are unable to use our services, and generally lead to unfavorable user experience.
The suggestions in this ticket seek to try to avoid the need for users to create a support ticket and instead better self-service their own sites.

h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Healthcheck regarding billing contacts for Cloud sites

fields.description:
For a plugin running on Forge, we will be able to use the existing security approvals on our side to use it, because it’s running on your infrastructure and hardware.

For a plugin not running on Forge, we need to have a separate security approval for that plugin vendor and a plugin assessment which is a very long process. 

We would like to see a marketplace badge that distinguishes Forge built plugins vs non-Forge plugins.
fields.summary: Marketplace Badge for Forge Plugins

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the Jira cloud to cloud project migration tool does not copy over the automation rules in the project.

It would be great if the rules were copied over so that admins won't have to manually create/import the rules from the source site.
h3. Workaround

Follow this guide to [Import and export Jira automation rules|https://support.atlassian.com/cloud-automation/docs/import-and-export-jira-automation-rules/] from the source site to the destination.
fields.summary: Cloud to Cloud migration tool does not copy project automation rules

fields.description:
Right now, when the production data is copied to the sandbox, it is leaving the web links pointing to other applications' production addresses.

In case the customer is creating a sandbox for other applications, he may want to change the web links to point to their sandbox address.

As shown in the screenshot attached, sandboxes were created for Jira Align and Jira Sofware, but in the Jira Software sandbox, the web link is pointing to the Jira Align production.

For that reason, we are asking for a way to remove, disable or update the web links during the sandbox copy in Jira Software.
fields.summary: Copy from Production to Sandbox Cloud is leaving the web links pointing to other applications' production addresses.

fields.description:
h6. JOB STORY

When we create the sandbox instance and import the production data, we would like to be able to choose to copy the permissions from the creator of the sandbox, only.
h3. Workaround
 * In the import process, choose to copy group membership for *all users* and then adapt; or
 * Configure the permissions manually for the sandbox creator
fields.summary: Ability to copy the permissions only from the Sandbox creator in the import from production to sandbox

fields.description:
The current page showing data residency can be confusing (see screenshot) and cause unnecessary concern for customers. In the screenshot the location is 'Europe PINNED' but the AWS region includes 'US East...'.
 
It's not explicitly obvious as to why there is an aws-region outside of the requested location.

As I understand it, the in-scope data is pinned to Europe but the out-of-scope data results in the US AWS region appearing. Explaining this distinction would help to remove any concerns/confusion/negative conversations and also reduce the number support incidents requesting clarification.
 
It would be great for the user interface to separate the in-scope and out-of-scope data, so that: * It is possible to see that the in-scope data is pinned to the requested location along with the associated aws regions for that location.
 * It is possible to see that the out-of-scope data resides in <location> along with the associated aws regions for that location

Include a direct link to [https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/understand-data-residency/#Managedataresidency-In-scopeproductdata] to explain In-scope data would also be helpful.
fields.summary: The admin Data residency page causes confusion regarding aws regions

fields.description:
As of now, the Tizen browser that comes along with Samsung TV and Flip 2 is not supported by the Atlassian product and users face difficulty in loading different pages.

Having the browser listed in the supported [list of browsers|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/supported-browsers-for-atlassian-cloud-products/] is much appreciated.
fields.summary: Support for Tizen browser
Ability to click om Organization to sort them like all the other items

fields.description:
I see on your product page:

[https://www.atlassian.com/software/statuspage]

 

that digital ocean (https://status.digitalocean.com/) got status history and we think it's very useful for announcements even replacing our current machanism. Centralized in status page makes it the single source of truth, saving a lot of back and forth. How does digital ocean get that?
fields.summary: status history on status page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you delete a sandbox with a trial app with an expired trial, you won't be able to create a new sandbox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a sandbox
# Install a trial app
# Let the trial period expire
# Delete the sandbox without uninstalling the app
# Try to create a new sandbox
# Below error message will appear
 !image-2021-11-25-11-50-48-147.png! 


h3. Expected Results
A new sandbox is created.

h3. Actual Results
You receive an error message telling you to uninstall the app, which is not possible since the sandbox was deleted.


h3. Workaround
Submit a request to Atlassian support team and request a hard delete of the sandbox.
fields.summary: Can't create a new sandbox if you delete a sandbox with apps with expired trial

fields.description:
Hi Team,

We are a municipality and secured access is our primary requirement. It would be good if you add IPallowlist feature on standard version as well.
fields.summary: IPallowlist feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, we use Atlassian Service to Service Authentication Protocol (ASAP) for internal system to system communications.
You can read about it here: [https://s2sauth.bitbucket.io/spec/]

The request is to implement mTLS for all system-to-system and service-to-service communications.
fields.summary: Implement mTLS for all system-to-system and service-to-service communications.

fields.description: At the moment, third-party apps and app data can't be copied into a sandbox. It would be of great help if we have this feature implemented to run some tests with add-ons.
fields.summary: Ability to copy App Data into a Sandbox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a project used default workflow scheme in Jira, the project export fails
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project
 # goto Project settings -> Workflow -> Switch scheme
 # Select Default and click associate
 # Run a Clod to Cloud migration with this project

h3. Expected Results

Migration should complete successfully
h3. Actual Results

Migration fails with below error

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException: null
	at com.atlassian.migration.jira.classic.service.ProjectServiceKt.toMigrationSpec(ProjectService.kt:170) {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Associate the project with some other workflow scheme if it's OK
fields.summary: Jira Project cloud to cloud migration fails when project uses default workflowscheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issues can hold references to sprints in the Sprint custom field. If this sprint does not belong to the current board, this issue will not import successfully.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link an issue to a random sprint
 # Migrate the project

h3. Expected Results

Things work
h3. Actual Results

The migration fails, or succeeds with missing issues
h3. Workaround

Remove all cross-project sprint references from your issues and try again.
fields.summary: C2C migrations fail to migrate all issues due to unresolved sprint dependencies

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

All C2C migrations for projects that use the default FieldLayoutScheme fail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Unlink your project from its field layout scheme (if already linked).
 # Migrate the project to another site using the C2C tool.

h3. Expected Results

The migration works.
h3. Actual Results

The migration fails. Logs show that the failure is due to a dependency on a non-existent field layout with ID 10000. 
h3. Workaround

Associate your project with any FieldLayoutScheme before migrating (you may unlink it after the migration, if you'd like).
fields.summary: Migrations for projects with default field layout scheme fail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Duplicate comments are created on the target site
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Unknown
h3. Expected Results

Migration works fine
h3. Actual Results

Duplicate comments are created on the target site
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: C2C Migration results in duplicate comments

fields.description:
It would be helpful to include the ability to separate different products into different Administrative groups, based on product.

There are some situations where you'd like to set up different administrative teams for different products (like having independent Trello or OpsGenie admin teams), and it would nice to be able to separate specific products from being unified through a Domain Claim.
fields.summary: Allow for Separation between Products when claiming Domains

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sandbox *Copy production data* fails if the license applied on parent site doesn't match the one on Sandbox.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Products > Sandbox*
 # Under *Actions* in the product table, select *Copy production data*
 # The data cloning will fail with an error message in the backend log

h3. Expected Results

Cloning of data to be completed
h3. Actual Results

Nothing gets copied and no clear error message is shown.
h3. Workaround

Reach out to support to confirm and the cause and if it is related to this bug, manually fix licenses.
fields.summary: Sandbox Copy Data fails if license count doesn't match the parent site

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Current usage reports don't specify the amount of seats used on Enterprise license
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a report so Enterprise customers can see the summary of their Enterprise licenses and how many accounts are using it.
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Add a report for the amount of seats used on Enterprise license

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is difficult to configure an allowlist when you have several IP addresses that need to be added to the list. This takes a longer time during maintenance windows when you need to remove or re-add the list. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a solution to export the list (e.g. to JSON) so that it can then be re-added quickly
fields.summary: Allow customers to import/export IP allowlist

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a Cloud to Cloud migration, if a project doesn’t have a board, sprints and its issues won’t be migrated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create project A with a scrum board
# Create an issue in it and add it to a sprint
# Start sprint
# Move issue to DONE
# Close sprint
# Create new issues in project A
# Move board with sprint into project B
# Migrate only project A to another Cloud site
# C2C migration is successful and issue count in JCMA is correct, but issues in the sprint are missing in the target site

h3. Expected Results

All issues from migrated project should be in target after successful migration.

h3. Actual Results

Although C2C migration is successful and issue count in JCMA is correct, issues are missing in the target site.

h3. Workaround

# Delete project in target site
# In source site, move the boards with the sprints to the project to be migrated
# Run the migration again
# All issues should be there in target site
fields.summary: If a project doesn’t have a board, sprints and its issues won’t be migrated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Logging out and logging in from start.atlassian.com and then moving to a product shows the user as not logged in.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to start.atlassian.com.
 # Loggout from start.atlassian.com.
 # Log back into start.atlassian.com.
 #  Navigate from start.atlassian.com to a product like Jira.
 #  User is not logged in and needs to log in again.
 [^Screen Recording 2021-11-04 at 13.47.26.mov] 
Har file  [^Logging issue.har] 

h3. Expected Results
The user should move to a product already logged in.
h3. Actual Results
The user must log in again after moving from start.atlassian.com. to a product like Jira

h3. Workaround
Log in again once you navigate to a product.
fields.summary: Logging out and back in from start.atlassian.com and then moving to a product shows the user as not logged in.

fields.description:
It appears Atlassian uses SendGrid to send email from the cloud.  This is a known spam company and often ends up on blacklists so email ends up being dropped or quarantined. 

There needs to be a way to set a mail relay in the cloud the way there is with the on-prem versions of the product.  This would permit companies to use their own mail relays without having mail relayed though a known spam company.
fields.summary: Email sent by known spam company

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some issues do not get migrated when not associated to a Sprint

* In one instance, this happened when issues were associated to a Sprint that no longer exists
* This has also happened for issues that are not associated to any Sprints

h3. Notes

During a test migration, a project migration completed without errors, but several issues did not get migrated. 

We've found that associating those issues to a new Sprint and re-migrating brought all of the issues over. 

Only error we see in the migration logs is:
{noformat}
ERROR	Number of other not-shown Chunk Migration Errors: 1051
{noformat}
fields.summary: Add a Sprint association pre-check

fields.description:
Currently, there is no option to assign sites users to the role *Trusted* via API.

This suggestion is to make this possible.
fields.summary: Ability to grant the role trusted via API

fields.description: As an admin , I would like to have the ability to remove the tab "Discover" option from the Switch to tab. Please refer attachment. We do not want to see "More atlassian products" under this Discover tab.
fields.summary: Allow admins to remove the "Discover" option from the "Switch to" tab.

fields.description:
As a Jira user, I want to have an immediate visualization of the progress of a ticket based on the checked off checklist items.

*What there currently is*

Currently, we only have the "Checklist Progress %" option, which textually indicates this information (For example, "8/10").

!image-2021-10-28-11-29-39-565.png!

*What I like to be added*

The above however has visual overhead and I believe a progress bar will give much more immediate information.

!image-2021-10-28-11-27-30-301.png!

The on-hover of this element can still show the textual progress of the checklists.
fields.summary: Add Card Layout option for "checklist progress bar"

fields.description:
Today, you can sign up for certain Atlassian cloud products (Jira Software, Jira Service Management, and Confluence) under the subdomain of your choice. For example, if your company is Acme, you can host these products under acme.atlassian.net

It would be nice to have a IP address to point internal DNS at that will provide a http 301 permanent redirect to the new domain name.  For instance Jira.acme.com would redirect to acme.atlassian.net.  This way users would not need to run a web server internally to get the redirect.  

This could ease the release of CLOUD-6999 where users will want to point back to Jira.acme.com after moving from acme.atlassian.net.
fields.summary: IP address to provide a 301 redirect to new domain

fields.description:
Currently it is possible to access Jira Credits on Jira Cloud instance with following URL without any authentication: 

[https://yoururl.atlassian.net/secure/JiraCreditsPage!default.jspa]

Access is possible via direct link, but there is no Jira Credits in the UI.

It won't be possible to access any content, buy might be a concern.

There should be on option to turn this on/off for public view.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict access to https://yoururl.atlassian.net/secure/JiraCreditsPage!default.jspa

fields.description:
Adding users to groups requires more clicks on the Improved User Management UI.

In the old User Management UI, the group list card stays when clicking on groups:
 !image-2021-10-26-16-08-55-650.png|thumbnail! 

In the new User Management UI, the group list disappears once you click on a group:
 !image-2021-10-26-16-09-00-835.png|thumbnail! 

If an admin wants to add a user to multiple groups, this becomes cumbersome.
fields.summary: Adding users to groups requires more clicks on the Improved User Management UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deleted Sandboxes remain on [https://admin.atlassian.com/] products after deletion.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Delete a sandbox
 # Check the _Sites and products_ list on the left column from.
 # It will still be listed there

h3. Expected Results

Deleted sandboxes should not be displayed, or at least marked as delete on the UI.
h3. Actual Results

Sandbox is made unavailable, but still listed.
h3. Workaround

Creating a new sandbox will replace the deleted one.

Wait for the actual _hard_  deletion of sandbox, or force one to happen by reaching out to us, (Support could also do it themselves)
fields.summary: Deleted Sandboxes remain on https://admin.atlassian.com/ organization products after deletion.

fields.description:
I run a Field Operations Training Site for my company, where we are reducing calls from our technician helpline on information that can easily found on Confluence. It is _highly inconvenient to look up an individual user's page view history_. You have it to where I would have to check all my pages and count it up individually. 

*This could be easily fixed if I selected my date range on space analytics > Users > Click on specific user >  drop-down would list the quantity and which pages they viewed.*

This would help any company that prioritizes training their employees or reporting on which departments are effectively using the site.

Thank you!
fields.summary: User's page view break down on Space Analytics
